Package rover

Class Engine

java.lang.Object
rover.Peripheral
rover.Engine
class Engine
extends Peripheral
The EV3 lego brick can be connected to motors, here called Engine.
Author:
Antoine Stevan

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private static int acceleration
    The constant acceleration of the motors allocated to the wheels of the rover, in degrees per second per second.
    (package private) lejos.robotics.RegulatedMotor device
    Precision about the Device of an Engine.
    private static int speed
    The constant speed of the motors allocated to the wheels of the rover, in degrees per second.

    Fields inherited from class rover.Peripheral

    port

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    Engine​(lejos.hardware.port.Port port)
    One can initialize an Engine by giving it a port.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    (package private) boolean connect()
    Connects a Motor to the EV3 lego brick.
    (package private) Measure read()
    For now, there is nothing to read from an Engine.
    (package private) void write​(Order order)
    It is possible to talk to an Engine by giving it an order, containing both the speed and the relative angle of rotation.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Field Details

    • speed

      private static final int speed
      The constant speed of the motors allocated to the wheels of the rover, in degrees per second.
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • acceleration

      private static final int acceleration
      The constant acceleration of the motors allocated to the wheels of the rover, in degrees per second per second.
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • device

      lejos.robotics.RegulatedMotor device
      Precision about the Device of an Engine. Here, it is a RegulatedMotor.

  • Constructor Details

    • Engine

      Engine​(lejos.hardware.port.Port port)
      One can initialize an Engine by giving it a port.
      Parameters:
      port - the port of the Engine, it is basically a MotorPort, from A to D.

  • Method Details

    • connect

      boolean connect()
      Connects a Motor to the EV3 lego brick. If any error occurs during the connection, the error is converted into a boolean and returned.
      Specified by:
      connect in class Peripheral
      Returns:
      true if the peripheral is properly connected to the right port, false if any error occurs.

    • read

      Measure read()
      For now, there is nothing to read from an Engine.
      Specified by:
      read in class Peripheral
      Returns:
      a measure given by the connected device, inside a Measure which is a data container.

    • write

      void write​(Order order)
      It is possible to talk to an Engine by giving it an order, containing both the speed and the relative angle of rotation.
      Specified by:
      write in class Peripheral
      Parameters:
      order - data is sent to a device inside packets of data called Order.
